p: Pereira et al. ( 203) evaluated three extracts (20 mg/mL) from A. humile leaves (ethanol, butanol, and hexane fractions) against S. mutans, S. aureus, and A. actinomycetemcomitans by agar diffusion and broth microdilution. Inhibition halos ranged from 9 to 19 mm, with the best result being obtained for ethanolic extract against S. aureus. MIC evaluation revealed a 0.50 mg/mL value for S. mutans, 1 mg/mL for S. aureus, and 3.50 mg/mL for A. actinomycetemcomitans. Chloramphenicol (10 Î¼g/mL) presented halos ranging from 19 to 36 mm.
